thread.title: Navratri 2015 begins with viral Maa Durga ‘Shadow Art’ by artist Sana Anil Kumar
thread.title_full: Navratri 2015 begins with viral Maa Durga ‘Shadow Art’ by artist Sana Anil Kumar

author: Rashmi Mishra
title: Navratri 2015 begins with viral Maa Durga ‘Shadow Art’ by artist Sana Anil Kumar
text:
Navratri 2015 begins with viral Maa Durga ‘Shadow Art’ by artist Sana Anil Kumar By Rashmi Mishra on October 13, 2015 at 6:09 PM Comments One of the most celebrated festivals in India Navratri began with joy and happiness on Tuesday, October 13. To mark the commencement of Navratri 2015, shadow artist Sana Anil Kumar made use of his creativity to make an idol of Maa Durga. His Ganpati shadow art has gone viral during the Ganesh festival and now with Sana creating yet another masterpiece leaves the worshippers pleasantly surprised. The picture of Maa Durga shadow art has been shared multiple times ever since posted by Sana on Facebook. Also Read: Navratri 2015: Know the Durga Puja Muhurat & auspicious timings of Ghatasthapana Muhurat . Just like the popular Ganesh shadow art , Sana Kumar made use of several daily use products both big and small to prepare an idol of Maa Durga. The shadow art nicely depicts the Goddess Durga sitting on a lion and carrying different weapons in her ten hands. The mighty form of Maa Durga symbolizes the embodiment of feminine and Shakti (energy). The ten days and 9 nights, Navaratri festival is celebrated as it symbolizes the triumph of good over evil. According to the Hindu mythology, Maa Durga destroyed the demon king Mahishasura after everyone failed to defeat the evil demon. After a ferocious battle that lasted nine nights, Maa Durga killed Mahishasura on the 10th day. The worshipers celebrate the famous victory of Maa Durga over the evil.
